Uses of Package
edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.hmmalign

  • Packages that use edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.hmmalign 
    Package Description
    edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.hmmalign
    This package contains implementations of IBM model I for statistical machine translation as well as an HMM model including extensions for handling fertility, part of speech tag information, and NULL correspondences.
  • Classes in edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.hmmalign used by edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.hmmalign 
    Class and Description
    AlHandler
    This serves to handle the alignment probabilities the basic functionality is getProb(i,j) and incCount(i,j,val);
    AlHandlerHMM1
    This serves to handle the alignment probabilities the basic functionality is getProb(i,j) and incCount(i,j,val);
    AlHandlerHMM2
    This serves to handle the alignment probabilities this is trigram HMM
    ATable 
    ATableHMMHolder 
    IntPair
    Title: Statistical MT tool Description: Your description Copyright: Copyright (c) 1999 Company: Stanford University
    IntTuple 
    ProbCountHolder 
    PTable 
    Sentence 
    SentenceHandler
    Reads in the corpus both training and test and stores them in buffers
    SentencePair 
    StayGoTable 
    StayGoTables
    stores several stay go tables for different contexts
    TPHandler
    Writing separate classes to handle the translation probabilities with or without tags; these classes take care of the caching and reduce the mess in the em_loops in the models.
    TTable
    This class holds the translation table p(f_word|e_word).
    TupleCounter
    This class keeps track of how many times a certain tuple occurred, in order to be able to discard the rare ones.
    Word
    This class holds a word Id together with a tag Id Later other fields might be added as well
    WordEx
